availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William L. Rowland (Calloway County, KY, prov govt conv rep)

body.p: Calloway County, Kentucky, laborer, farmer, and dry goods merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy J. Rowland. Laborer in Calloway County in 1850. Dry goods merchant in Calloway County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Farmer in Calloway County in 1863. Served in the 7th Mounted Infantry, Kentucky Volunteers (C.S.A.) as private from December 7, 1861, to May 7, 1863. Paroled prisoner at Demopolis, Alabama, on June 30, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 2, p. 425B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, p. 279.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0066.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Calloway County, Kentucky, p. 20 of book, (Accessed via ancestry.com on November 20, 2019).
KYR-0004-033-0001.
